p: The species Condea undulata (Schrank) Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Hyptis fasciculata Benth.) accumulates labdane diterpenes, such as 15 β-methoxyfaciculatin ( 34), 15 α-methoxyfaciculatin B ( 35) and methoxynepetaefolin ( 36) ( Ohsaki et al., 2005). The roots of Condea verticillata (syn. Hyptis verticillata) afforded seven abietane type diterpenoids, identified as 7-acetyl-12 methoxyhorminone ( 37), 7-acetoxy-16-benzoxy-12-hydroxyabieta-8,12-diene-11,14-dione ( 38), 11,14 dihydroxy-12-methoxy-8,11,13-triene-7-one ( 39), 11,14-dihydroxy-12-methoxy–18(4→3 βH) abeo-abieta-4(19),8,11,13-tetraene-7-one ( 40), 7-acetoxy-12-methoxyabieta-8,12-diene-11,14-dione ( 41), 7,6-dehydroroyleanone ( 42), 7-acetoxyhorminone ( 43) ( Bakir et al., 2006; Porter et al., 2009).
